title: 113_s2652
content: Design-build construction process improvement. Amendment to Section 3309 of title 41, United States Code regarding civilian contracts, specifying that the maximum number of offerors in a solicitation should not exceed 5 unless approved by the head of the contracting activity. The contracting officer must justify why more than 5 finalists are necessary and provide written documentation supporting the decision. Amendment to Section 2305a(d) of title 10, United States Code requires two-phase selection procedures for design and construction contracts valued at $750,000 or more. The maximum number of offerors in a solicitation is limited to 5, unless approved by the head of the agency contracting activity. The amendment to Section 2305a(d) of title 10, United States Code mandates two-phase selection procedures for design and construction contracts valued at $750,000 or more. The maximum number of offerors in a solicitation is limited to 5, unless approved by the head of the agency contracting activity. The annual report for each executive agency must include instances of design-build contracts awarded with more than 5 finalists or without using two-phase selection procedures. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget designates agency heads as executive agents for this purpose. The executive agency is designated as the executive agent for compiling and providing public access to the required report. The first report must cover instances during the fiscal year of the Act's enactment, with additional reports for the next 4 fiscal years. Each report must be issued within 60 days after the end of the fiscal year. The Comptroller General of the United States must issue a report within 270 days after the final report deadline. The Comptroller General of the United States will issue a report on executive agencies' compliance with specific legal requirements. The term "executive agency" is defined in section 133 of title 41, United States Code.
